intro: Narcissus tortifolius, commonly known as the twisted-leaved daffodil, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is characterized by its distinctive, twisted leaves and bright yellow, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats and is part of the Amaryllidaceae family. It blooms in early spring, adding a vibrant splash of color to its natural environment. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
